Linux GTK AMD64

1. Started Eclipse on existing workspace
2. Switch to a non existing workspace
3. Crash with following log

Will check if it is reproduceable. Sending to Core since they show up in the
stack trace and in case it rings a bell.

At the moment my build always crash with the same stack trace previously reported.

To get started, I removed the eclipse/configuration/org.eclipse.* folders.
Eclipse showed up.

Switching to a non existing workspace consistently failed again.

Same use case works on W2K.

Not seeing it anymore at the moment.

Any chance the stack trace would reveal a lot of objects are allocated that
should  not be?

It's hard to see the cause because the original OutOfMemoryError has no stack
trace.  The OutOfMemoryErrors that happen during shutdown are likely just
side-effects of the original error.
can't reproduce anymore so this PR can be closed.

causedBy.message: Exception in org.eclipse.ui.internal.UIPlugin.stop() of bundle org.eclipse.ui.
